fast3d.renderables

Class Pixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.math.geom.Point
      • fast3d.renderables.Pixel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeometricObject, Renderable

    public class Pixel
extends Point
implements Renderable
    visualized like a 3d-pixel (a point with a width of 1px and a color)
    no matter how far the camera is away, a pixel will always be shaded to the size of one single pixel on the screen
    points/pixels disappear on mathematically correct ray-tracing imaging, because they have no actual width (like when using the DefaultFragmentShader)
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double defaultRayIntersectionZeroLockControl
      determines the default value for the rayIntersectionZeroLockControl on instancing a line
      double rayIntersectionZeroLockControl
      on ray-intersection-computing (ray tracing) it is normally impossible to target a mathematical point (with actual no width) using rastered rays like when displaying an universe to any computer screen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pixel(Vector3d pos, Color col)
      constructs a new 3d-pixel on the specified location and with the specified color
      both can be changed directly by the references given by getPos() and getColor()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj) 
      Color getColor()
      the pixels color (rgb) might be changed by the (xyz)-coordinates of the casted vector3d
      Point getPoint() 
      Vector3d[] getVertices()
      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
      may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
      void moveInAbsoluteDirection(Vector3d dir)
      adds the given vector to the position
      void moveTo(Vector3d target)
      moves the pixel so that it will be at the target
      Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray
      may return null
      void render(Graphics3d g)
      called when this renderables is requested to draw itself on screen on the way prior calculated by shade()
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
      during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
      java.lang.String toString()

      • shade

        public void shade(Graphics3d s)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Specified by:
        shade in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null
